reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Hilarious Platformer / Arena Gamehttps://youtu.be/UonXVeinvhg
+ Extremely gruesome deaths, you will see chickens die in the worst of ways with blood splattering everywhere
+ You can continue to flap around after your head, legs, or both get chopped off
+ Loads of content (description says over 200 maps!)
+ Local-Multiplayer allowing you to play co-op through the main game or in the cockfight arena
+ The levels themselves look great with some 3D detailed environments with some great lighting and shadows
+ Unlockable hats and modifiers to enhance the arena mode
+ Very challenging, expect to die a lot!

This game is in Early Access so don't take these too seriously
- The thrusting" ability is hard to use
date:
I'd often end up going upside down and dying when all I wanted to do is dash across a simple vent
- Can be a bit frustrating and hard to progress through some of the levels especially considering how difficult the chicken can be to control and maneuver through some of the obstacles.


Playing with a friend:
https://youtu.be/j_ZobqBPyzc"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good fun, I do recommend it, the price is a tad on the steep side though. check out my video review below, or scroll a little further for review using bullet points!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=icpc1gUMeCU
Early Access, The reason the developers have advised this is going into early access is to get feedback for more polish and make it better.
Single player, with three zones and 40 levels per zone,Steam mentions 200 levels. So we may have a hidden zone upon completion, it has a nice amount of content just wish the price was lower.
Versus Co-op, a lot of laughs to be had across six different levels, modifiers picked up from the single campaign add alot of crazy gameplay mechanics.
Graphics, a really nice design, backed up a good quality graphics
Audio, nothing amazing here
Gameplay, a really unique input style, partnered with a crazy game concept. A real interesting little title.
Key Provided by Developer.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Chicken Nugget Simulator 10/10

This game pretty much gives you look at how cruel the life of Jesus (if his soul was trapped inside a chicken) can be if he would be used as a resource to produce chicken nuggets.

***Pros***
Challenging levels
Suited for speedruns
Multiplayer
Difficult controls, when mastered can do some really cool stunts
Hats! (very few options to choose from though, hoping to see more in the future)
Variety of different hazards (traps, enemies etc)
Ability to poop eggs
Did I mention that you can poop unlimited amounts of eggs?
... Also you can poop on your friends (in-game) :D
***Cons***
Some of the trap patterns are too difficult to read that it is almost impossible to figure out a way to get past them. When encountering these, most of the time you just have to pray to Jesus (not chicken Jesus) that you'll get through alive.
Maybe the biggest con of the cons: No option to play online with friends

reviewText:
Product received for free

This video features a non-biased quick look @ the game only:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=02v0-JcShoU

A fun and hilarious gory platformer that takes time and skill to master.

Game Details:
Chicku is a nail bitingly hard platformer in which the player has to escape the Barrington farm. You’ll be forced to dodge saws, spikes and many other deadly traps in order to save your brethren and rise against the evil Dr. Barrington. Play alone or with friends in this epic adventure and slaughter save millions of chickens along the way.

When you’re done saving your species, challenge your friends’ flying skills or their ability to handle a weapon in the bloodthirsty cockfight arena.
Also, why not wear a fancy hat while you do it?

Playing with a controller/gamepad is highly recommended

Recommended?
Yes!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Chicku's influences are clear: Flappy Birds, Angry Birds, Super Meat Boy... even the film Chicken Run. The result is a simple, amusing game that's charming enough to keep you playing for a good session or two.

The selling point of the game is the simple but annoying control system, based on rotating your chicken around 360 degrees, and tapping a button to flap in that direction. There's also a button that freezes you for a second, then fires you in the chosen direction, taking you safety past obstacles such as blowy pipes.

These controls result in genuinely funny (and gory) moments of chaos, and while you do get better with practice, the fact your chicken is so prone to gravity means you're never far from death.

Gameplay highlights video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9J16IWK3Z9w

Chicku's campaign mode consists of LOADS of short, spiky levels. Almost too many - the game spreads itself quite thin and you might be waiting quite a while before something genuinely new turns up. But the levels are so short (some can be completed in a couple of seconds) that it's got a great sense of pace, urging you onwards.

Most levels are just get to the end"
date: but occasionally you'll need to collect stuff over the course of as many lives as you need. For completists
hoursPlayed: two or three coin award depending on your best speed. The coins can currently be spent on randomly allocated hats.\n\nThere are more unlockables (that seem to come after a certain number of levels or coins
voteText: I wasn't entirely sure) that can be used to modify the game with crazy disco balls and the like.\n\nThe multiplayer versus mode
votesHelpful: puts you in a choice of arenas of similar size to the campaign levels. A variety of weapons and tools spawn for you to collect and use to kill the other player. Time limits can be changed
votesTotal: silly modifiers (once unlocked) can mix things up.\n\nSo it's one of those games you jump in
votesFunny: get confused by for a few minutes
commentsCount: get into the spirit of it and blitz through half of it very quickly. Beyond that
column16: it'll be worth a few more goes
column17: plus waiting to see what is added over the course of early access. If you can sort out local multiplayer
column18: the battle mode does look fun
column19:
although these days it's up against a LOT of arena games that offer more complexity.

* Version reviewed: 1.01 (Early Access)
* More indie gaming videos by Randomise User"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

FULL VIDEO REVIEW: https://youtu.be/u57e_xSp-2Y
PROS:Chicku makes me want to throw my controller at the wall constantly…but in a good way. Gameplay is silly and challenging to appeal to both hardcore platformer fans and those just looking for a laugh.
Entire game is 4-player local co-op compatible, making it an outstanding party game. Anyone can instantly drop in and out of the game without interrupting gameplay.
240 levels is plenty of content to keep you satisfied.
CONS:Some levels have a bit too much randomness thrown in, resulting in scenarios where you need to get lucky to win.
Chicken controls are a bit tough to get used to.
Pretty much required to have a controller to play the game as the precision of movement necessary to beat some of the harder levels is nearly impossible on keyboard.
SUMMARY:Chicku is the love child between Super Meat Boy and Flappybird creating a game that is a well-designed and unique take on the platforming genre. Your goal is to fly your chicken through the maze avoiding grinders, grills, and other obstacles dangerous to chickens. There are 120 unique levels in the game and an additional 120 nightmare levels. The nightmare levels are the same layout as the original levels but with a TON more obstacles and traps. Best of all you can play the entire game with your friends, as every level in the game can be played local co-op. While the game can be frustrating at times overall it’s a silly, rewarding experience that has more than enough content to be worth the $13 price tag.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best way to describe chicku is some wierd combination of Super meat boy and Flappy bird

GOOD
- it looks and sound good. Very goofy, playfu and gruesome theme that works very well
- the gameplay is most of the times very fun.(depending on what level you are on). like mentioned earlier its probably inspired by SMB and Flappy Bird and it has taken the most appealing parts of thoose two games and merged them well.
- Motivates the player to replay levels to get coins and unlock hats \^O^/
- a lot of varied levels to play
- no bugs encountered! gratz!
- fun but slightly too chaotic multiplayer mode.

BAD
-I only have one negative thing about the game to say but its a biggie for me. some of the levels are very unfair and not fun at all especially lvl 45... which is a fun idea but a horrible experience to actualy play. All the hardest levels are sadly at the moment the least satisfying. because they require precision to complete and the game lacks that in some of the controls, which leads to just replaying the levels untill you happens to slip through by chance (atleast for me) the charge move which should be used for precision sometimes put you in an unexpected direction after being used which contribute to this problem.

I still think it is worth playing in its current state. the price is very fair for the content. These unfair" levels are not that many and the only totaly horrible level ive played so far is lvl 45.

The game as it is right now (early acess) is very entertaining but with some updates has potential to be amazing!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NOTE:  I want to thank Gatling Goat Studios for reaching out to me and giving me a Steam key to play this game to make a review and record some game footage before the game launched in Early Access.  As always, this has no effect on my review or my scoring for the game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cyNuIyooplA

This game is really, really fun and makes you want to play again and again.. But I warn you now.. it's isn't easy!

Prepare to die, and to die often!  Prepare to watch your poor chicken carved into chicken nuggets in all sorts of bloody, gory ways!  ..And that's a big part of the lure to this game!

While you can use a keyboard and mouse, a controller is definitely recommended.  You have a total of 3 maps, each with 40 levels, so 120 total levels in all to try and get your chicken to break open a crates with little trapped chicks inside.  Flying past all the spikes, spinning saw blades, and many other hazards is where the challenge comes from, each level progressively getting harder and harder.

There is also a local multiplayer mode where up to 4 local players can all duke it out for the claim to the most brutal chicken ever!

The ability to play each of the 120 levels and earn coins to equip your chicken hero with cool cosmetic gear" adds to the addiction of this game and it really is a game that is a ton of fun to play!


Heres my scores for this game based on my own unique scoring system:

Value:  33 out of 40.
Fun:     28 out of 30.
Controls & Bugs:  20 out of 20
Graphics & Sound: 8 out of 10
-----------------------------------
MY TOTAL SCORE:  89%

The price of this game is the biggest reason this game didn't score higher.  Even though there is a ton of levels and replayability
date: I just feel that if this game were priced a little lower
recommended: it would be much more appealing
hoursPlayed: so if you can catch this game at 50% off or better from it's $12.99 asking price
voteText: then my score for this game rises into the mid 90's!  That shows you how awesome I think this game really is!\n\n"

reviewText:
Product received for free

Video Review:
https://youtu.be/dTA21_jO0VE
Ever wonder where your chicken nuggets come from? This platformer is Super Meat Boy slid his double quarter pounder into Flappy Birds and gave it his secret sauce. That is Chicku. BTW, do yourself a favor and play this game with a controller.
WARNING: The game is graphic in that is has copious amounts of cartoon blood. If you are with PETA, move along, this is not the game you were looking for.

ON TO THE REVIEW!
Sound: 7/10
Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Replayability: 7/10

This platformer does have integrated multiplayer. Co-Op and Deathmatch. Nothing like playing a suicide bomber chicken to take out your friends.

SOUND:
Basic sounds and music that doesn't annoy you after 4 straight hours of gameplay.

GRAPHICS:
Cute cartoon mayhem within this slaughterhouse of horrors. Every death allows for another layer of blood to wash over the background with each subsequent death (as long as you remain on that level obviously).

GAMEPLAY:
I feel this game is well worth the $10 it is going for, for its coming out of Early Access sale price. Even for the regular price of $12.99, I would still pay that much for this game. (***Note, publisher provided a game key for review purposes, but in no way has influenced my personal or professional feelings on this game***). If you mess up slightly and barely nick a hazard, it is not always game over! (YAY!) That is because it is possible to loose your wings, legs, and even head, and still be able to complete the level. I really really enjoyed this little perk of game play, so you can literally run around in game as a chicken with it's head cut off.
All in all, there are 3.5 world types with over 120 levels to beat. After certain levels, you get to unlock perks to add to your multiplayer death match, like Zero Gravity. The levels occasionally will have multiple paths to take to beat them, depending upon your play style.
Co-Op consists of local players dropping into game by pressing 'A' on their controller and helping you to clear the level.

REPLAY:
This game has decent replay as you go back through and attempt to beat your previous level clear times. There are a total of 3 coins per level to be obtained, which can then be used to purchase custom hats and headgear for your chicken. There is nothing like running around blowing friends up while your chicken wears a bloody Jason Hockey Mask!

Overall score: 8/10
Now go cause some mayhem!

reviewText: This game is quite fun but after awhile the fun wears off. In truth the developers  in my own opinion were ‘lazy’ granted I understand the vision at first was for a single player then adding in split screen co-op made sense HOWEVER  in this day and age and especially uploading to  steam  the developing team should have considered working in a online multiplayer.  If they were to INCLUDE it (see fourms for dev’s mention of possibly adding as dlc or standalone)  I see this game staying under the radar of popularity with low sales.   Word of advice to the developers, if you wish your game to sale PLEASE include a multiplayer and I GUARANTEE  sales will rocket  especially when youtube celebs begin playing it.      Though time will tell this game is fun and quite entertaining  (for a short time)  but without a co-op/versus  (lan/internet) this game will fall in the to  junk pile.    Till some sensible multiplayer is implemented  I cannot suggest this game to anyone.
